conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D interior: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, multi-face wall geometry, and an elevated isometric-like view with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and interior volume; clean cutaway and stable projection with minimal distortion. Minor simplifications in wall detailing/edges compared to plan.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and main adjacencies match (central living/dining core, kitchen on left, bedrooms around perimeter). Some wall/door placements and proportions appear approximated (curved/arched segments and several openings do not clearly correspond 1:1 with the 2D door swings and partition locations).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, tables, beds) and generally placed in plausible corresponding rooms; kitchen blocks included; bathroom presence suggested but fixtures are simplified/less explicit.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/openings; good visibility and clean presentation with no UI/text contamination. Minor readability loss from uniform materials and simplified openings.

detected_errors.description: Several partitions/openings appear positionally approximated versus the 2D plan (notably around the central corridor and some perimeter wall segments).
Door/window mapping is not fully verifiable as exact: the 3D shows multiple openings but some do not clearly align with the specific door-swing locations and window runs in the 2D drawing.

summary: A valid, clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability and largely faithful layout, but with noticeable approximations in exact wall/opening placement versus the 2D plan.
